alert.note: Alert for Garza (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 3:59PM CDT until August 31 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Garza County in northwestern Texas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 359 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding along US 84 southeast of Post and on SH 380 east of Post. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Garza County FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
